graphicalMCP 0.1.0

    • Generating the closure tree

    Check if all sub-graphs have weights summing to 1

    analyze_graph.Rd

    Check if all sub-graphs have weights summing to 1

    analyze_graph(graph)

    Arguments

    graph

    An initial_graph as created by create_graph()

    Value

    A list with elements is_optimal and offending. If is_optimal is TRUE, offending should be an empty matrix. Otherwise, it's a matrix of intersection hypotheses whose weights do not sum to 1

    Examples

    hypotheses <- c(0.5, 0.5, 0, 0)
transitions <- rbind(
  c(0, 0, 1, 0),
  c(0, 0, 0, 1),
  c(0, 1, 0, 0),
  c(1, 0, 0, 0)
)
names <- c("H1", "H2", "H3", "H4")
g <- create_graph(hypotheses, transitions, names)

analyze_graph(g)$is_optimal
#> [1] TRUE
#> [1] TRUE

g$transitions["H2", "H4"] <- .9

analyze_graph(g)
#> $is_optimal
#> [1] FALSE
#> 
#> $reason
#> [1] "subgraphs"
#> 
#> $offending
#> $offending$subgraphs
#>    H1 H2 H3 H4   H1 H2   H3   H4
#> 1   0  0  0  1 0.00  0 0.00 0.90
#> 2   0  0  1  0 0.00  0 0.95 0.00
#> 3   0  0  1  1 0.00  0 0.50 0.45
#> 8   1  0  0  0 0.95  0 0.00 0.00
#> 9   1  0  0  1 0.50  0 0.00 0.45
#> 10  1  0  1  0 0.95  0 0.00 0.00
#> 11  1  0  1  1 0.50  0 0.00 0.45
#> 
#> $offending$connectivity
#> [1] rows cols
#> <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names)
#> 
#> 
#> $is_optimal
#> [1] FALSE
#>
#> $offending
#>    H1 H2 H3 H4   H1 H2   H3   H4
#> 3   0  0  1  1 0.00  0 0.50 0.45
#> 4   0  0  0  1 0.00  0 0.00 0.90
#> 5   0  0  1  0 0.00  0 0.95 0.00
#> 9   1  0  1  1 0.50  0 0.00 0.45
#> 10  1  0  0  1 0.50  0 0.00 0.45
#> 11  1  0  0  0 0.95  0 0.00 0.00
#> 12  1  0  1  0 0.95  0 0.00 0.00
